```{r}
# Load required packages
library(dplyr)
library(readr)

# Load the country top 10 CSV and convert "N/A" to NA
COUNTRY_TOP_10 <- read_csv("data/mp01/country_top10_alltime.csv", na = "N/A", show_col_types = FALSE)

# Verify column names
colnames(COUNTRY_TOP_10)

# Fix season_title NAs
COUNTRY_TOP_10 <- COUNTRY_TOP_10 %>%
  mutate(season_title = if_else(season_title == "N/A" | season_title == "", NA_character_, season_title))

# Count the number of unique countries
num_countries <- COUNTRY_TOP_10 %>%
  distinct(country_name) %>%
  count() %>%
  pull(n)
